definition: scattered and smashed (idiom)
surname Zhi
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
mythical beast (archaic)
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
surname Li
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary

sentences.english: The fragmentations of teacher beliefs were eventually damage education hope.
sentences.chinese: 教师信奉的支离破碎最终则损毁了教育的希望。

sentences.english: Dear my baron, you're my broken dream.
sentences.chinese: 柯希莫，你是我支离破碎的梦想。

sentences.english: Drug discovery and development efforts are fragmented across the continent.
sentences.chinese: 药物发现和开发措施在该大陆支离破碎。

sentences.english: Part of the problem is the state is very fragmented.
sentences.chinese: 该州这个问题有部分又恨支离破碎。

sentences.english: And then the dreams break into a million tiny pieces.
sentences.chinese: 然后美梦变得支离破碎，碎成几百万个小碎片。

sentences.english: Bodies were blown apart or charred beyond recognition.
sentences.chinese: 尸体被炸得支离破碎，或烧至难以辨认。

sentences.english: But as the body metabolises the alcohol, sleep may become fragmented.
sentences.chinese: 不过因为你的身体分解了酒精，睡眠会变得支离破碎。

sentences.english: The police has only a few bitty evidence.
sentences.chinese: 警方仅有一些支离破碎的证据。

sentences.english: The world of 2666 has been irretrievably shattered.
sentences.chinese: 《2666》的世界无法挽救地支离破碎。

sentences.english: The swirling wind caused the entire house to shake and start to fall apart.
sentences.chinese: 旋转着的风使整个房子摇动起来，并逐渐支离破碎。

sentences.english: A single pieces of memory has make me dream of chain of nightmares.
sentences.chinese: 一种支离破碎的回忆也能让我魂牵梦绕。

sentences.english: Significantly, the borescope inspections were marked by fragmentation of the process-flow.
sentences.chinese: 显而易见，孔探的检查程序被支离破碎地执行了。

sentences.english: Bad translation mutilates the original work.
sentences.chinese: 拙劣的译本将原作删改得支离破碎。

sentences.english: PW: Well, it is part of living in a broken, sinful world.
sentences.chinese: 这正如我们生活在这个支离破碎，充满罪恶的世界。

sentences.english: How did this conflict get so fragmented?
sentences.chinese: 冲突如何变得这么支离破碎？

definition: (idiom) everything broken and in disorder
bits and pieces/scattered fragments
to smash to pieces/to shatter
see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
to crush/to smash/to shatter
nothing remains the same (idiom); change beyond recognition
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
chip/fragment/splinter/tatter
broken/dilapidated
smashed up/broken into pieces/thoroughly mashed/pulpy
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
badly damaged/shattered
